description:
Creates an RabbitMQ Secret Backend for Vault. RabbitMQ secret backends can then issue RabbitMQ credentials,
 once a role has been added to the backend.

~> **Important** All data provided in the resource configuration will be
written in cleartext to state and plan files generated by Terraform, and
will appear in the console output when Terraform runs. Protect these
artifacts accordingly. See
[the main provider documentation](../index.html)
for more details.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

DefaultLeaseTtlSeconds.description:
The default TTL for credentials
issued by this backend.

Description.description: A human-friendly description for this backend.

MaxLeaseTtlSeconds.description:
The maximum TTL that can be requested
for credentials issued by this backend.

Password.description: Specifies the RabbitMQ management administrator password.

Path.description:
The unique path this backend should be mounted at. Must
not begin or end with a `/`. Defaults to `rabbitmq`.

Username.description: Specifies the RabbitMQ management administrator username.

VerifyConnection.description:
Specifies whether to verify connection URI, username, and password.
Defaults to `true`.
